page.title: 12Education in Alresford
page.content: Alresford has a population of 2300, and just one village primary school. This is a fairly new school, catering for 4-11 year olds and is attended by approximately 200 children. There is no secondary school, either public or private in the village, and the children over 11 have to travel to Brightlingsea, Colchester or elsewhere to continue their education. This generally presents little problem since communications are good and there is a regular bus service from Colchester, Clacton and Brigtlingsea to Alresford. There is also a good train service from the village to Clacton, Walton and Colchester. As well as the Alresford primary school the village has a pre-school playgroup and a toddlers group.
